Description: White or green glazed steatite scarab: engraved on the base with a crude design of quadruped (dog?) with crosshatched body moving right, above its back the plant of Lower Egypt. In front of the animal an indeterminate sigm, perhaps 'nfr'. Top abraded.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Charles Francis Tyrwhitt Drake (?)
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.188, no.36)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
